stdout:
Table	Create Table
workOrders	CREATE TABLE `workOrders` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
  `userId` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `workOrderNumber` varchar(50) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci NOT NULL,
  `quoteId` int(11) DEFAULT NULL,
  `clientId` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `clientName` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci NOT NULL,
  `clientEmail` varchar(320) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `clientPhone` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `clientWhatsapp` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `serviceDescription` text COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `technician` varchar(255) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `laborHours` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT '0',
  `laborCostPerHour` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT '0',
  `laborTotal` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT '0',
  `materialsTotal` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT '0',
  `totalValue` varchar(20) COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT '0',
  `status` enum('open','in_progress','completed','delivered','cancelled') COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT 'open',
  `openedAt` date DEFAULT NULL,
  `completedAt` date DEFAULT NULL,
  `notes` text COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci DEFAULT NULL,
  `createdAt` timestamp NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  `updatedAt` timestamp NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP ON UPDATE CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  PRIMARY KEY (`id`) /*T![clustered_index] CLUSTERED */,
  UNIQUE KEY `workOrders_workOrderNumber_unique` (`workOrderNumber`)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8mb4 COLLATE=utf8mb4_unicode_ci
